website_summaries.verdict: The Microsoft All-in-One Media keyboard is a keyboard-plus-touchpad combo for home theater PCs that is both low-cost and simple to use.
pros: For a modest $30, the Microsoft All-in-One Media keyboard includes a built-in touchpad, physical volume controls, and WIndows 8 shortcut keys
cons: The lap-spanning keyboard feels cramped, it lacks a backlight, and it's designed for right-hand users only

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless all in one keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I will be using this to control my computer, which is connected to a TV, from across the room. The keys are decent, I guess, although I'm used to a mechanical keyboard. It is just the right weight, not noticeably heavy, but it has enough weight that it doesn't feel terribly cheap. The trackpad works well, although I had to track down separate software from Microsoft to turn off the tap to click function. It would seem like Microsoft could provide that functionality in their own operating system with a product they sell, but I digress. I wouldn't use this as my main keyboard for gaming or for lots of typing, but for managing and accessing media it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Not all functions are Mac OS compatible
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with my MacBook pro. It's really good quality, solid and cool looking keyboard. But it is NOT mac OS compatible. General functions like mouse and keyboard is working fine but you can't use other touchpad features like 2 finger swipe or zoom, you can't control the sensitivity and speed of touchpad and you can't use the function keys on keyboard except volume keys. Otherwise it is a good Bluetooth keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ekin E.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great keyboard. I was looking everywhere for an all-in-one ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. I was looking everywhere for an all-in-one without a function key in the bottom left, and a full sized shift key, and this fit the bill. Initially I was frustrated with the keyboard because the Function keys defaulted to their media key functions, and were messing with my normal keyboard shortcuts (when Alt - F4 puts your computer to sleep instead of closing the window it's quite annoying). Since there's no Fn Lock key to be found on the keyboard, I was afraid I may have to return it, however I came to find that you can toggle the Function lock by pressing Fn + Caps Lock and now this is the perfect all-in-one keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Little II

customer_reviews.title: Bad signal
customer_reviews.text: Using it for my J5005 HTPC, but signal quality is abysmal, even with direct line of sight at less than 3m, I keep getting cursor jumps, missing keystrokes, and accumulated keystrokes, which sometimes in a different windows or program, is problematic. I had to get a 3 feet USB 2.0 extension to solve the issues, very weird, probably to separate the receiver from other components on that HTPC (I think USB 3.0 ports are the culprit).
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a wireless dongle that fits into a USB port (it's not Bluetooth). Windows 10 recognized it essentially instantly and it was up and running. If you don't like the defaults (like tapping on the trackpad is a left-click) you can download a setup utility from the Microsoft Web site that lets you configure the software to do what you want. It even lets you set up the "media" key (the one with a picture of a pair of headphones) to start iTunes. It's wide enough to sit easily on my lap. Probably the only thing I can fault is the trackpad is designed to be used with your right hand (I'm left-handed).
customer_reviews.author: C. Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Great HTPC Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Microsoft Wireless All-In-One Media Keyboard to replace our home theater PC (HTPC) keyboard. I love the fully functional keys and the layout of the standard keys on the keyboard. There are some small keyboards that make some of the keys smaller, such as the shift-key, but the Microsoft keyboard does not do this. I am able to easily type and get stuff done! The touchpad works great, so no complaints there. The range is so much better than our old Logitech keyboard. I can easily sit 6-10 feet away from our HTPC and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Fahillion Tech

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with the MacBook (Macintosh OS X)- DON USE WITH MACBOOK
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, it is NOT compatible with the MacBook(Macintosh OS X). Definitely Not. It looks good, ergonomic and I really like it. There is no typing sound. But, NOT compatible with MacBook. I am not able to use any shortcuts with it. Like ctrl(command)+C, ctrl(command)+V, ctrl(command)+T, ctrl(command)+v or any of not working. If you wanna use it with the Windows operation system, definitely I suggest it. But NEVER TRY WITH MACBOOK Please remove "Macintosh OS X" from "Operating systems".
customer_reviews.author: Barraxcuda

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for Chat
customer_reviews.text: I use this to type in chat while playing on the Xbox. It works well most of the time. Sometimes I have to turn it on and off for it to work properly. Sometimes the letters keep typing even though I am not touching the board. I am happy with it as I only use it for typing and not game play. I don't think it would be responsive enough for actual gaming as there seems to be a slight delay when I am typing and the letters appearing in chat.
customer_reviews.author: rating pen

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play, using on an Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, he uses it on his Xbox One, USB port on the side of gaming unit. Easy to setup, it was plug and play. He uses it to code while playing Minecraft, he says it makes it a lot easier than using the gaming control.
customer_reviews.author: M Kessinger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Theater PC use
customer_reviews.text: Using with an HTPC from across the room and it just works fabulously. I was disappointed when there was no conventional up-down scroller zone on the right side of the touchpad but it took about 5 minutes to get used to the two-finger scrolling that it does support. My only "ding" for this keyboard is that the F-keys (F1-F12) are dual-mapped to media keys and there is no way to permanently choose which you want the keyboard to default to (it always starts up favoring the media keys). Other than that, it's great for my specific use. Update: 2 months of continuous use and I'm still on the original batteries. Update: 11 months, still using the original batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Solid Wireless Keyboard for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: This unit is incredibly well-built. It feels sturdy in your hands and doesn't creak/pop with handling. The track pad feels high-end. I LOVE the volume control buttons! I wish the unit came with a sleep-button built in, as many other Microsoft keyboards do. I will caveat that pressing two keys at once can sometimes lock movement while gaming. You wouldn't want to play a competitive shooter with this keyboard as it can make tapping while strafing/moving a real chore. Pros: Build Quality, connectivity, trackpad works great Cons: Not for FPS gaming due to key locking, could use a few extra misc buttons such as Sleep
customer_reviews.author: Johnny V Whichard

customer_reviews.title: Better than other wireless boards.
customer_reviews.text: Best of 4 wireless boards we have owned. Keys in normal places, not scattered or missing as most other wireless boards. Keys have siort of a good feel but to me the best keyboards are in Thinkpads over 10 years old. Trackpad is good for today with left & right buttons in lower area. Not a trackpoint but good as a trackpad. Look on web for instructions & settings. Works for me using Linux-GNU sans any MS driver. Probably uses unencrypted radios, probably not a bit secure. Good enough for me in rural area. No wake delay like BT boards. No need to use power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lee Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: Update... 7 Aug 18 Disappointed. Intermittent connection, sometimes not working at all. un-installing drivers help for a short time. (hving trouble typing this rvew) <--- See! Just not happy with Microsoft Wireless All-In-One Media Keyboard. Update 8 Aug 18 I am so frustrated With this piece of junk that as soon as I can I'm gonna buy me something different. I am very disappointed, very disappointed that Microsoft would allow this out and sell it for any price. Microsoft needs to do a recall on this product and give everybody a refund . I have never been so disappointed In a Microsoft product as I am With this product .
customer_reviews.author: M.G. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard in July to replace an old Logitech keyboard. There is no Caps Lock key so you don't know whether you will use upper or lower case until you begin typing! I've replaced the lithium batteries twice thinking they were worn out but have now discovered that this keyboard will only connect to my Dell XPS 27 when placed directly beneath it and not on the shelf designed to hold it. The keyboard's transmitting power is pathetic. This keyboard is the worst I've ever used over 28 years. It's junk!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael E. Sedgwick

customer_reviews.title: Touch pad is touchy!
customer_reviews.text: I have two other brand all-in-one wireless keyboards and I use them all the time. I wanted to try this one out to see if it was as good as the other brand. The touch pad doesn't work as expected at all. Either the touch is too light or too hard. The pointer jumps around on the screen with the slightest touch or it stays in one spot no matter what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Mutant DBA

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this. There's a problem though. I often put my computer display to sleep but keep the pc running. I've done this forever. For whatever reason, when this thing is plugged in, my display wakes itself up shortly after. Very frustrating. Otherwise, I really would have like this thing. Gotta send it back now. :(
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Beware of jumpy touchpad
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works for the most part as expected the only issue I had was with the touchpad it’s a little too tacky whatever the coding is on and it causes your fingers to stick skip. This is frustrating for me because I bought this keyboard to use through a USB switch to manage multiple desktops so I use it quite a bit There are no technical issues with the keyboard it operates as it should installed very easily it’s a nice layout and I size if I wanted to touchpad had a better coating on something a little bit more slick.
customer_reviews.author: jill madison

customer_reviews.title: Meets only the basics for a smart TV
customer_reviews.text: Since the keyboard is wireless (that is, you will need to put an adapter in the USB port of your TV), and it does not have bluetooth, it is not recognized as a keyboard for smart TV. So many functions cannot be used (I can't even use the touchpad). But it meets the basics, like being able to type texts.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Wireless = Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Got this at a great price point - it's good to type on. I also have a wireless Logitech mouse. If you wanna not have your eyes burned out or wanna control your desktop/laptop from bed, kitchen, or ANY other place than right in front of the screen, I highly recommend investing in a both a wireless keyboard & mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Idea-L Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Convenience Use
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard/mouse combo I/O device works well with Mint Linux, is easy to put down and pick up, and it's black ... not black and silver or black and incinerate your eyeballs neon psychotic grasshopper green ... just black. It's hard to find elegant black I/O devices really. I used this at my drafting desk, where it's convenient to have keyboard and mouse together, and both as small as possible without harming usability. While I hate touch pad mice in general, it is far worse to keep a separate mouse around at a drafting desk. One USB dongle takes care of both mouse and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Covey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality wireless keyboard with large Trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard despite some negative reviews about connection issues and touchpad sensitivity. None of these issues have been experienced on my Windows 10 64bit desktop installation. Masking in Capture One and Affinity photo is easier with the large size touchpad. The left click button and volume controls on the left side of the keyboard are a great features and seem natural to use. Some settings, such as scroll up or down are only configurable when the Microsoft Keyboard software is installed. There is no Print Screen key, however one reviewer suggested using the Windows Snipping Tool as it provides the same function with additional controls for partial screen selection.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Compact clean looking
customer_reviews.text: I never liked using a pad instead of a mouse for navigating, but this one is pretty good since it's right by the keyboard. No need to move your hand to reach your mouse (though it's not that far, it matters when you are really into typing and navigating) Also it's better to carry this one board instead of a board and a small mouse. Connection was very easy, reaction is good, so far there is no problem at all. I see many other similar models but I chose this since it's Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Samba

customer_reviews.title: So smooth...Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this evening and so far an instant hit! 2 1/2 year old Lenova laptop touch pad and select button died. Replacement was going to be 1/2 the cost of a whole new computer. Can put on my lap, perfect size! Same spacing as existing keyboard but keys have much better feel. Touch pad and click controls fit perfectly into space where the useless numeric pad used to be - efficient. Not only meets current need but has capacity to work with Smart TV as well. More to explore!
customer_reviews.author: Roseybluemoon

customer_reviews.title: Works well for certain use cases.
customer_reviews.text: Works well along with single board computers or for diagnostics. One minor annoyance is that the "function" of dual function buttons is the default. Changing this IS possible, but it reverts after each power cycle. For example: To use F9 to access a boot menu or BIOS, you would have to old down the function (Fn) button.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a media center computer
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a great all-in-one to control a media center pc/laptop then this is the one. Simple and well made, perfect for simple browsing and media viewing. I've had it a year and have yet to replace the batteries. That said, I would not recommend it for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable keyboard, mediocre trackpad, does work with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable keyboard, mediocre trackpad. Works well with Linux. Would have given this 4/5 (minus 1 for the trackpad) but seems like the signal runs into issues with missed mouse movements and keystrokes, seems like it may be subject to interference or some other issue making it hard for the dongle and they keyboard to communicate intermittently so I took off a star for that. I'd still recommend it for the comfortable keyboard but buy it used.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Beaven

customer_reviews.title: Good simple keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love? You insert the USB stick and you're typing (in my case with a Surface Pro 3 and docking station). Amazing how MSFT is packaging these things - very well done - definitely stood out upon arrival. Works from across the office, good range. Nice black color - consistent mold pattern throughout the device. Not sure I can pull the keys to clean it out one day, but not to worry about that today. Would like to perhaps customize the optional keys other than going direct to Bing music or prescribed locations. May be a way to sort that out, have not explored and must conclude it's not a priority.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycoholic

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Very bad touchpad and i bought this because i needed touchpad :D Its software and customization options are too bad also. Very bad product and so high price. Shame on you Microsoft once more. Update: I try get used to it but can't. This is the worst product i bought on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: sergi

customer_reviews.title: Bad design on the touchpad
customer_reviews.text: The left and right mouse click buttons are basically impossible to use correctly because they are a part of the touchpad. So when you move your hand to click them, the cursor also moves, and you end up clicking somewhere else entirely. The right click has a "sweet spot", so more often than not, my right clicks register as a left click instead. I would rate this five stars if only they had just made physical buttons that weren’t touch sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Item well packaged and protected. Arrived timely and reasonably priced. This product is time tested, meaning its been around for years. Using it to communicate with ASRock Rack Xeon E3-1245v5 mini-itx web page server running OpenSUSE in non-gui mode. Had to use short 8" usb cable connected to back usb 2.0 port for keyboard's wireless module since metal case was obstructing signal. Very pleased. Product could be improved if had two flip out bottom feet to elevate angle of keyboard (15 degrees) making it easier to type. Recommend item and Seller.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Geek Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keybaord
customer_reviews.text: Softest keyboard switches ever. Unlike any mechanical / membrane keyboard. I wish this thing had backlight and a better trackpad but wow this thing rules. Make sure you download Microsoft Keyboard software so you can configure the keyboard to your liking. Receiver distance is a bit short but those keys.... <3
customer_reviews.author: Neutrality

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's sleek. It has a mouse pad. I even managed to connect to my TV and phone and manipulate episodes on Hulu with it. I keep it on my sidetable in case I need to type something. It's not often, but I enjoy having it and the mouse just makes it that much more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Perfect Media Remote, With One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a remote for the laptop I retrofitted to serve as a chunk of my media center. It is almost absolutely ideal for that purpose. The touchpad functions about as well as any other laptop touchpad. It has, in addition to the traditional right and left click buttons, a left click button on the left side of the keyboard in addition to volume control buttons you would commonly use in such a media setup. The only downside is that it has no power save mode, meaning, if you leave it on by accident it will need new batteries after a day or so, even if you aren't using it. Other than that, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Adroa

customer_reviews.title: Research carefully for compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is well built, and has a great key touch feel. It appears to work fine with a computer, but the touch pad does not work with a Samsung UN43J5200AFXZA Smart TV. All other facets of the keyboard worked, and I could have opted to use the arrow keys for navigation, but it was still a combination of the TV remote and the keyboard to try to get something done. Returned the keyboard for a refund, while the research continues for a larger, compatible keyboard. Turns out the Logitech K400 Plus works perfectly with the Samsung Smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Horwath

customer_reviews.title: Good range.
customer_reviews.text: Good keyboard. Good range, I can control my computer behind the TV from the couch about 8 feet away. It has the new “clean” look. Touchpad is typical and acts just like a laptop touch pad. This works great for my home media pc.
customer_reviews.author: Tisen

customer_reviews.title: Compact, functional size.
customer_reviews.text: I use this whenever I hook up my laptop to the TV or projector and want a mobile keyboard for control. It’s simple to use and works great. I haven’t found many other keyboards that also have touchpads that are a reasonable, functional size like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is well designed and fairly comfortable to use. Compared to the Logitech K400, it is slightly wider and the buttons are a bit smaller. The larger size is due to a bigger trackpad which I actually prefer and you will get used to the smaller button uses for the left mouse click. The keys have decent travel and response. Battery life has been solid so far, used well over a month on the same batteries pretty frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: meh...  the trackpad is horrible
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard part is fine... but the trackpad is just horrible. It doesn't work well. In the age of huge trackpads (Apple), I don't understand why there aren't more options for windows. It's a big fail.
customer_reviews.author: Sang

customer_reviews.title: Track pad has horrible precision. Go with K400 or something.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly its a great board but the track pad is rubbish. It has really bad precision which is annoying because i bought this not need to use the mouse. I would have gave it 4 stars and not 5 for the in accurate track pad because you can use it fine. Except i bought this to slouch in my couch and use and its annoying sometimes. clicks on stuff or drags stuff while using the track pad. I tried the Logitech board and looking back I would 100% chose the Logitech board.
customer_reviews.author: Rashid

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, works very well with Windows (expected it of course). Quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Everything works perfectly. Keys are very comfortable, mousepad is great (i dont see the problems here as some previous reviewers noticed, reacts, works ok), materials are quality ones. I have used Logitech keyboards previously, but every item broke or didnt work correctly after some time. Especially with Windows 10 i have had a glitches. So- went to Microsoft, im really pleased. Im using it with my PC, but tend to use it with my smart tv later on. Lightweight, easy to use- especially for media, every knob what i need for media is presented. Customizable with pc program. Im satisfied. Well need some more time to give comments about durability and battery life. Will do it later.
customer_reviews.author: Olari V.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Windows 10 and Android 8
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Windows 10 PC. I have it working with my Google Nexus Player running Android 8 too. The Google Nexus Player requires a cable that converts the micro USB to standard USB to allow this device to plug into. Just plug it in and go; no special/manual installation steps necessary on either platform. Proximity and line-of-sight is key in getting this media keyboard to work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: n-squared

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite keyboard...
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 Logitech K400 keyboard for all the TVs in my home (using Intel NUCs as HTPCs) and needed another keyboard for my media server. That's when I found this little gem. It's slightly bigger than the K400... or maybe it's just heavier? On the top of my head, the noticeable differences are: the batteries use AAA vs. AA for the K400, the right shift-key is the correct size (the K400 is too small), the mouse pad is much larger, and it just looks nicer. I liked the how the drivers setup...just seems more native. This is my new favorite keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Ok keyboard, but it’s too small.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard functions fine and connects easily, but it is about 20% smaller than a standard keyboard. Fine for using with a smart TV, but definitely too small to use with a PC. I only detracted the two stars because of the small size and the fact that the trackpad “pinch to zoom” feature was really hit-or-miss with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Product description on Microsoft website states that it's compatible with ...
customer_reviews.text: Product description on Microsoft website states that it's compatible with Mac OS. (even though limited compatibility such as no Windows 10 gestures, etc). The keyboard doesn't even respond. And I tried it on two separate Mac machines. Shame on you. If I lived in the US, it'd be a simple issue of return/exchange but now, the return shipping will cost two times more than the value of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander P Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: After using for a month this keyboard almost had me throw my PC through a window. Doesn't stay connected well often losing the touchpad. Keys bleed feel like their pressed when not pressed causing issues. This keyboard is for very basic general tasks using wireless. I wouldn't recommend this for anyone. Price was okay, seems I got what I paid for.

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for media PC's
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good wireless keyboard for the money. Mainly using it for my media PC on my TV and it's been a huge improvement over the mini keyboard/mouse contraptions. I originally tried the popular air mouse and Rii I8 mini keyboard but had nothing but range/connection issues and crazy mouse control problems. The only knock I have is the trackpad scrolling is reversed from what I am used to. The good thing is it can be changed using MS media keyboard software for Windows PC's.
customer_reviews.author: jpotegal

customer_reviews.title: Could never get the thing to work
customer_reviews.text: Have had great luck with Microsoft products over time, but this one simply failed to work. Tried 3 different sets of batteries (rechargable, non-rechargable) and 4 different computers. DOA!
customer_reviews.author: AlanS CO

customer_reviews.title: Nice keys, nice size, touchpad is lacking sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: Great touch on the keys. The touchpad isn't terribly sensitive or accurate. Important tip: if you want to be able to us the F-keys (e.g. F1,F2,F3...) without having to hold the Fn key, you can use Fn+CAPSLock to switch the mode. This is not really documented anywhere that I could find, nor is it in the software.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R

customer_reviews.title: great value as an htpc keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice keyboard especially for th price. I like that it can interpret gestures as would a touch screen. This makes using windows 10 on my 50" TV via htpc that much more intuitive. This is a great value. Also like there is an on off switch on the side to keep it from accidentally waking p the computer at night (nosey dogs). The size I find perfect for operating the htpc from the living room couch. Not awkward to operate with one hand. It isn't backlit but I don't find it hard to find keys in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Rule

customer_reviews.title: For Once Microsoft made me happy and tingly all over.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact keyboard, it is far cheaper than similar ones like Logitech's and it does it's job and works great with Windows 8. I was never a fan of touchpads on laptops but when I added an iMac to the home office I got both a mouse and trackpad and became addicted to the gestures and quickly was won over. Trouble is I missed using the trackpad and even the flatter keyboard design that I have with the iMac when I switched between it and my PC that I used as a secondary PC. This fills that gap gives me the same keyboard style and a trackpad as well. Made me a happy man.
customer_reviews.author: Eff Ewe Leo

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool keyboard. Don’t listen to the haters. I payed $30 for this keyboard, to replace my wireless keyboard that w s a d keys stopped working. The older keyboard and mouse cost me $80. Also I love the zoom feature.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Price

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is total junk and i would get a logitech instead. this keyboard just fails in a lot of categories, including the fact that its not actually bluetooth. the trackpad is way touchy
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard/trackpad combo.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our all-in-one PC that sits near the dining table. This got rid of the wires from the mouse & keyboard. Size of the keyboard is a little small for my tastes but I do not type on it much. It is perfect for our 7 & 10 year olds. They love the trackpad also. Works great with Windows 8. We also have a Logitech keyboard similar to this one that we use with the PC connected to the TV. It is smaller than this Microsoft keyboard and the right shift key is very small on the Logitech. I prefer this Microsoft keyboard because I believe it is a great compromise between functionality & size.
customer_reviews.author: TR from WA

customer_reviews.title: intermittent pad function . not frequency or distance or battery issue.
customer_reviews.text: trackpad keeps jerking like crazy. hard to pin point things on your desktop. literally can't rest your hand cuz you've been then multi touching the pad and it won't move at all. the only thing I love was the keys feel. trackpad...you better off with Logitech. I thought it was cuz some other device making interference or something so I shut off my phone deactivated the bluetooth even the router from my internet , got really close to the receiver but the same thing keeps happening. Horizontal drag was more faster than vertical drag. In fact the whole thing was a drag. Not recommended. Thats what I get for betraying Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The trackpad could be better; but I love this for a few reasons
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad could be better; but I love this for a few reasons. One, it has a power switch! That's great for when you don't want the keyboard to accidentally wake up a device. I'm currently using it for my Steam Link. Easy enough to type on. Has a handful of extra useless buttons that few people will use, but nice touch nonetheless. An attractive keyboard/mouse combo for your coffee table, for use with an HTPC or game console, as I imagine many buyers will be using it for.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Would be okay if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the touch pad on this is annoying. You can theoretically disable certain gestures and defaults. I might have looked into that if the thing had worked properly, but the response lagged so badly I couldn't use it. The lag was intermittent, so it may be an interference issue, but all I have is a computer, a TV, a modem and a cable box, which I assume is what most people have if they are buying this. I am going to try one other dongle-based wireless keyboard and then give up and stick with bluetooth ones which are more expensive and have their own issues.
customer_reviews.author: Guy in Philly

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to control a HTPC. Tried one of those tiny remote keyboards and couldn't stand it. It worked, but was annoying. I love this keyboard. Intermediate sized, seems well made. The key travel etc feels right. The best part about it is the trackpad. Nicely sized, responsive and the "click" sounds solid. Regarding range, my components in in a cabinet so I ran a USB extender cable to the outside. I sit about 20 feet away and it works perfectly. No lag. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: RickyPetite

customer_reviews.title: The trackpad sucks though -- pretty imprecise and I'm constantly right clicking ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my pc hooked up to my tv and sound system. The trackpad sucks though -- pretty imprecise and I'm constantly right clicking by accident. Ok for the price and fine for my purposes... not good if you require lots of precise trackpad use. Also, the range is pretty bad. I have the usb receiver plugged into the front of my computer and if I try to use the other port on the front of my case next to it, the keyboard goes haywire and is unusable. I wish I had bought the Logitech K400
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Good with a Chromebox.  Volume buttons and trackpad work properly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my Chromebox i3. I use the chromebox with my TV to stream and also to web stuff like facebook and email. The keyboard and mouse that come with the chromebox i3 are not good for my use because I need the trackpad. This device worked out of the box. just put the usb receiver in and it ran perfectly. Actually seems to work better than the more expensive logitech. The track pad works well with the chromebox and it has touch click, as well as two finger scroll. I just ordered a second one to use with my PC at work.
customer_reviews.author: MB in the OC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Living Room Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The Microsoft Wireless All-In-One Media Keyboard is essential for any home theater PC. I really love being able to sit on my couch and easily browse my home theater pc that doubles as a game console. Although I have steam controllers that make text input easier, nothing beats a good keyboard. The touchpad also works very well, and Windows 10 Pro has many useful gestures that work out of the box with no software installation required. I would highly recommend this to anyone that plans on using a computer on their TV.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not Black, and Keyboard/Trackpad Cannot be used at the same time.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot use the trackpad and the keyboard at the same time. It's not black (Gray). It honestly feels like a logitech device, but the key spacing is a bit different. The mouse buttons are incredibly tough, and take quite a bit of pressure to activate. Install the keyboard specific software, and flip the two finger scrolling for a more natural experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Some quirks, very nice quality, dificult transition from k400.
customer_reviews.text: Some quirks, very nice quality, dificult transition from k400. Trackpad continues onto pushbuttons causing the need to disable double tap = click. Cursor moves when clicking and accidental double taps occur often. Best for two hand use so the auxiliary left click button can be used with the left hand. Needed to assign lock function to sleep button through software.
customer_reviews.author: DIY and Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: i like the keyboard but the only issue i have
customer_reviews.text: Bought it refurbished , i like the keyboard but the only issue i have , is that u need to press FN key plus the F key u want to work with this is a big issue for gamers cause if u speed only F4 without the fn key it will go to sleep i have to disable the suspended key on the power management menu on windows 10 cause of this , they have taken out the numberpad , and that touch works okay , it might get you a while to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Pichardo Linares

customer_reviews.title: Not Great, but it Works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard so I could use my PC from my couch. Mostly just to open a few applications and change a few settings before gaming with a gamepad. Honestly the range is much worse than I expected. Barely works at about 10 feet. I have to lean in towards the TV when I use it. The keyboard half isn't too bad from a tactile point of view, but the mouse touch-pad is pretty sub-par. It's nice and big which I appreciate, but seems very jittery. Overall it works for my limited use and the price was right, but if you need something for heavier use I would recommend a different product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kellen

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in these keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in these keyboards. I have two computers and bought a microsoft wireless keyboard for each. Within 4 months both have died. About a month ago they keyboard for my HTPC simply stopped communicating with the computer at all and today the keyboard for my bedroom computer did the same thing. I've changed the batteries and looked online for possible reasons that they stopped working with no luck. It turns out that Microsoft is just fine selling a product with a high failure rate. Buy something else. I'm pretty sure I flushed $60 down the toilet buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works for all my internet streaming needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for all home entertainment systems. I pair mine withfor a low profile setup. Keyboard is lightweight and has a good feedback when typing. Love that it doesn't have random brightly colored patterns splashed on the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Nice / Small Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: When these were the lightning deal of the day I picked up three of these. I put one on a Slate 21 Pro, 1 to a docked Windows 8 tablet, and the other attached to a TV that has a PC attached. They have worked great for all applications - although I would agree with some of the reviews I read that were less than thrilled with the function of the touchpad. That said, I'm still giving it 5 stars - it has an excellent price point and if you need something that is either small (takes up just a little desk space) or you can use across a room - these are great little units.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Grisom

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking keyboard with nice keytouch
customer_reviews.text: Returning this keyboard due to faulty "left click" of touchpad. Very nice looking keyboard, and the keytouch is nice and also quiet. Touchpad and keyboard edges take finger prints too easily, makes touchpad look dirty, from day one. Otherwise, nice keyboard if you are looking for one with a built in touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Nice AIO keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Logitech K400 series keyboard with this. Use with my home ubuntu file server. Chiclet-type keys have a little bump feedback and limited travel, but can't be prized out easily. It has survived the odd fall from the desk. Only downside for me is the touchpad. I tend to shift the mouse when clicking (effected by pressing the bottom of the pad).
customer_reviews.author: The Procrastinator

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite touchpad/keyboard unit
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite touchpad/keyboard unit! I previously purchased a Logitech unit which is the same size and has the same features, but where this Microsoft unit wins is the design. It is clean, professional, and does not have the silly squiggly designs on the touchpad that the Logitech has. Also, the bottom half od the keyboard is black and matches the rest of the unit unlike the Logitech. It is also noticeably thinner and lighter. Works from a good 10 feet or more away. Highly recommend, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: George Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this thing. I have had no problems with the trackpad. Although, it seems that if you leave the device on and the computer on, the keyboard goes into a sleep mode from which you wake it by pressing either the right/left click buttons or one of the keys. I have no problem with this. Battery hasn't been changed in a long time. Volume buttons and mute are a great addition since I use this for my home theater PC. Used with Windows 7, the scrolling, tapping, and gestures for the trackpad work great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boyko

customer_reviews.title: Besides occasional reception issues (they all have that I imagine) it has been great. Once you download the drivers from microso
customer_reviews.text: My old TV-puter remote wireless keyboard croaked from abuse from the kids and missing keys, which was a track ball type. This one was cheaper and the quality is higher. Besides occasional reception issues (they all have that I imagine) it has been great. Once you download the drivers from microsoft the it has programmable keys which I use to quickly open media player classic and toggle the a playlist. The volume function alone was worth the switch though. I had to fight the old one to track ball over to the various volume sliders. Overall a highly recommended TV-puter remote.
customer_reviews.author: eloquaint

customer_reviews.title: Good working keyboard, has no Insert, Home, Page UP/Down, keys, or FN Equivalent.
customer_reviews.text: Good working keyboard, has no Insert, Home, Page UP/Down, keys, or FN Equivalent, so for me that was a bit disappointing, as I use home and end frequently. And not having those will take some time getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: D. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: works with Mac, but not fully
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty good. I am using it with my Mac mini. But the trackpad can't do pinch zooms and side swipes and up swipes. But the trackpad does work as a basic mouse. I'm still trying to find drivers for Mac that make the trackpad function like an apple trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft media key board
customer_reviews.text: Craped out after 2 weeks...still within the amazon month return policy and return it I did! Sucks, I really liked the feel to it more so over the Logitech K400...
customer_reviews.author: A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: For one, the pad and the push buttons are on the same scale, means when you attempt to push the button, lets say left one, the pointer is moving as the button appears to be part of the mouse pad as well. Cannot believe someone sign off on this. You really have to pay attention when pushing buttons not to move the pointer. Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kubrat

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard seems to be great as long as you have line of sight to ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard seems to be great as long as you have line of sight to the device. I tried to use it with the receiver plugged into the back of a Intel NUC. Using the keyboard in front of or to the side of the nuc left me with skipped keys, non-functional trackpad. Moving the receiver to the front of the NUC made it work perfectly in all of the positions, but it is very annoying. Still haven't decided if it will stay around...
customer_reviews.author: Maresian

customer_reviews.title: Great key feel and usable trackpad
customer_reviews.text: Like the tactical feel and trackpad compared with another similarly-priced wireless keyboard. Not having a home key is a problem but overall a great product relative to competitive products
customer_reviews.author: Richard Klassen

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Keyboard & Trackpad
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are shallow meaning great response even with soft key strokes. The trackpad works great. I use this with a phone & dock for simple internet & email. Works great for basic use. So compact & convenient.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: No End, Home, Insert, or "list" keys.. bad layout.. not a fan..
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard actually frustrates me! I bought it for my living room, for casual use but find its missing certain keys (home, end, insert, "list"). Also, the "FN" functions in tandem with standard "F1, 2, 3" keys are mapped kind of oddly... Still trying to figure out how to enter full screen. The keyboard types well enough and the track pad.. is... ok.. no great... I would not purchase this keyboard again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: There is no way to make it able to pair with any bluetooth receiver.
customer_reviews.text: The only way to use the keyboard is to use the included Microsoft USB dongle. As such, you cannot use it with a tablet or smart phone unless you use an adapter cable as bluetooth is not workable with Android and IOS is not the keyboard has no way to make itself discoverable.
customer_reviews.author: muDDfish Mike

customer_reviews.title: but the trackpad isn't the greatest. It reminds me of a windows laptop trackpad ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well for what it is... a wireless keyboard with built in trackpad... but the trackpad isn't the greatest. It reminds me of a windows laptop trackpad from ~5 years ago. Instead of using two fingers to right click, you have to press the right click zone on the bottom right of the trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: adam m p

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: This combo is exactly what I was looking for. I use a media PC to watch TV and movies and such and this keyboard feels great to type on, the mouse is nice and responsive, the entire thing is very sturdy. All around a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn’t work like it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Same as what others have found. Keyboard itself is ok but the trackpad performs terribly. Granted the price is low but they really should have gotten the track pad right; it’s not some kind of new technology they’re implementing here. I can’t recommend this item unless there are no alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: C Wan

customer_reviews.title: You
customer_reviews.text: Still using this keyboard to this day, I'm happy with it and I super love the "left click button" added to the upper left side of keyboard for extreme convenient. Also the "home key, volume rocker, windows explorer, and music player button " is great really convenient and great. I don't recommend for heavy use for typing it'll strain ur hands bcuz its not big enough and it's really rare, sometimes the mouse pad is unresponsive after a while and I have to press a key or press down on the pad to get the mouse going I guess to wake up the pad. Other than that it's great def recommend to buy
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: OK, but doesn't track well.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Integrated keyboard and touchpad is convenient for small systems. I am running this with an Intel NUC. Cons: Touchpad tracking is very poor. The pointer tends to jump all over the place. If I turn down the sensitivity then it takes multiple passes to move from edge to edge. Also, annoyingly, it reverse scrolls by default. As with similar sized keyboards, it's smaller than a standard keyboard by just enough that touch-typing is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Kwan L. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Key keys missing.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing missing are the page up/down/home/end keys. If a company would just add those, this would be a perfect keyboard. Add an inch to the width so the keys will fit....it's not a big deal. I couldn't use this keyboard during my busy time of year for work because of these missing keys, and my work is spreadsheet intensive, where I'm a keystroke typist (not a mouser or menu user). I was stuck using my laptop keyboard for 4 months, I'd really like to switch to docking and use a big screen, etc.... Beggggggging Microsoft to rethink this design.
customer_reviews.author: jennynoel

customer_reviews.title: its worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: nice keyboard with plenty of room to type conveniently. wireless distance is enough, about 5 meters from couch to tele. I use it to work on my smartTV. previouslyI used a small cheapo keyboard with flumsy buttons. although this one is bigger in the hands i am working better on it. only thing i am missing is the slidding along the touchpad so to bring the screen up and down. otherwise I would given it the 5 star reward.. now only 4 stars but happy i bought this one.. for a very good price! so price/value is excelent.
customer_reviews.author: Joost

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, unusable trackpad
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad on this is horrible and unusable. Seriously aggravating. The actual keys/keyboard is also pretty bad. I know Microsoft can make good products, because I have the Surface Type Cover and it is perfect (keys & trackpad) completely unlike this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bonaventure

customer_reviews.title: Descent keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Did what I needed it to. Not a fan of the buttons being part of the track pad. You can’t rest your thumb on the left click key due to interference on the trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Grabill

customer_reviews.title: BEST KEYBOARD EVER
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is affordable, thin, lightweight and the best I have come across. My husband uses it daily and was very impressed with my find. He's a software developer so to impress him with things like this is a big accomplishment!
customer_reviews.author: JillHdz

customer_reviews.title: ... this keyboard today and so far it has been great! it works really well with my Windows 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this keyboard today and so far it has been great! it works really well with my Windows 7 laptop. The mouse pad works really good to. highlighting text and such to copy and paste with it is a two handed job but it does work good. Only reason it has a 4 out of 5 is because it wasn't just plug and play. i had to go to microsoft's website to download their drivers and software for the keyboard so you do need an internet connection or you won't be able to use this initially. But i still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works a lot better than the RF keyboard I had before
customer_reviews.text: Works a lot better than the RF keyboard I had before. One thing that's annoying is that you HAVE to hit the Fn key every time before using any of the F keys. For example, want to rename? Must hit Fn+F2. Want to close the window? Must hit Fn+F4. I wish there were a way around that but I can't find one. Microsoft typically tries to force you to use the F keys for something other than their original intention on all their keyboards and it drives me NUTS!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse A. Safir

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I truely do. Have had this for almost a year and it is still operating on the same batteries, love that it has the mouse all in one and it is super light and thin. Fits in the hands great and the usb reciever is really small but still works at quiet some distance away.i use this on the computer attached to my tv in the living room so u can image i use it often and with the all in one mouse pad it is easy to use from the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Mario A. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great for certain jobs
customer_reviews.text: I got this when it was on sale on the .com site and had it shipped to the US so it was only $18 usd. So for that price its been great for why I needed it which was when I have my laptop plugged in to my tv. I used to use a full size keyboard and separate mouse from the couch but now I just need this which makes things easier. I still prefer a real mouse to a trackpad any day so this all in ones usefulness will depend on what you need it for. For the sale price and things I need it for its a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: This is a good all around keyboard and touchpad. Its of course nice that its wireless, be aware however that its battery powered rather than rechargeable. Touchpad is a bit jumpy but works well enough. They keyboard is surprisingly light, almost too light to utilize fully on your lap. I recline on my chair at work with my legs on my desk and throw this on my lap and it works but isn't great for writing iliads. However, I still recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: shaun sandera

customer_reviews.title: the only thing that I don't like is the Bluetooth that connects to the wireless USB ...
customer_reviews.text: the only thing that I don't like is the Bluetooth that connects to the wireless USB is in the middle of the keyboard so it's annoying when you do something and it doesn't show up and when you lift the keyboard up everything just happens at once
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahem0g

customer_reviews.title: Weak off axis range
customer_reviews.text: Good depending on the application, but for my home theater setup it's kind of weak sauce. The range is only good for about 5 feet, after the keyboard starts to get laggy or just completely stops working. I added a 3ft USB extension and it now works fine, so much for the low profile USB receiver..
customer_reviews.author: nicholas

customer_reviews.title: A great little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've had this wireless keyboard for two years now am writing this review with it now. This keyboard has not crapped out on me ever. One of the best things about this keyboard is it's battery life. It takes two triple A batteries and will run for months on them. With cheap dollar store batteries maybe a month or two with heavy use. Good ones will make it last a longer. I would buy it again but I don't think I'll have to.
customer_reviews.author: Amzon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost a great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The reason it is getting a 3 star is because for whatever reason Microsoft decided that you can't press a button and use the track pad at the same time. I don't understand it. And you also can't disable that function. I understand if you could enable/disable the function but at least let me customize it some more. If they update the software I would change this to a 5 most likely because it's a great price for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Cole
